intro: Senecio davilae, commonly known as the Davales Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk, and its leaves are usually narrow and linear. Senecio davilae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
